result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amanda Clarice Johnson

records.addlTxt:
Defense contacted the Court and State via email regarding Plea hearing. Defense requested an adjournment. State did not object. 
Court vacated Plea hearing date of October 18, 2022. 
Clerk provided available dates to the parties. 

NEW DATE: Plea hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated 08-31-2022; received and filed.

Defendant Amanda Clarice Johnson appeared by video.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn appeared by video for Amanda Clarice Johnson.  Attorney Eric Bashirian in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense requested date for Plea hearing. Court ordered case adjourned for Plea hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Plea hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 10:00 am. Hearing will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Amanda Clarice Johnson in court with attorney Colin Patrick McGinn. Jacob Daniel Corr appeared on behalf of Eric Bashirian for the State of Wisconsin.

**JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense counsel received discovery material. Defense requested an adjournment to allow time to review Discovery and meet with Defendant.
Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Court ordered Defense and State to meet/talk at least 48 hours in advance of the next hearing. Scheduling Conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:45 pm. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.

JusticePoint PreTrial Services Status Report dated July 27, 2022; received and filed.
JusticePoint respectfully requests that the report of noncompliance from July 26, 2022 be removed from the record due to error.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated July 26, 2022; received and filed.
Court LOWERED Cash Bail to $7,500.00. All previously ordered conditions of bail remain.

Court ordered Defendant TURNED OVER TO JUSTICE POINT for LEVEL 5 SUPERVISION. 
All previously ordered conditions of bail remain.

Defendant Amanda Clarice Johnson in court with attorney Colin Patrick McGinn.  Defendant Amanda Clarice Johnson in custody.  Eric Bashirian appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

**JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Bail/Bond hearing. Court reviewed Defense counsel's Motion to Modify Bail. Discussion placed on the record. State complied with Victim Notification. Arguments heard regarding bail. Statements made by JDB. For reasons stated on the record, Court GRANTED Defense counsel's Motion to Modify Bail. Parties selected a new date for Scheduling Conference. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Scheduling Conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 01:45 pm. Hearing will be held VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.
Defendant's Motion to Modify Bail; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Bail/Bond hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 10:45 am via Zoom Video Conference.
Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference. 
Information provided to the parties and victim witness advocates.

Defendant Amanda Clarice Johnson, appear by video in court with attorney Colin Patrick McGinn, appear by video.  Defendant Amanda Clarice Johnson in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD J. Williams.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46. Defense wants to be heard on bail. Date provided by Br. 46 clerk.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

-received and filed. 
Attorney Colin McGinn

Defendant Amanda Clarice Johnson not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearng. State witness was present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with JDB.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Amanda Clarice Johnson in court with attorney Colin Patrick McGinn.  Defendant Amanda Clarice Johnson in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.

  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
K-Warrant
